definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: I think about you day and night.
Good programmers think about their work 24/7.
sentences.chinese: 好的程序員不分晝夜在思考完善自己的項目。

sentences.english: In principle a volcano can erupt at any time, day and night.
sentences.chinese: 原則上說，火山隨時都會爆發，不分晝夜。

sentences.english: They've been there around the clock for 10 consecutive days.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經連續10天不分晝夜地聚集在那裏。

sentences.english: The green food all day and night canned trust to take.
sentences.chinese: 不分晝夜都可以放心攝取的綠色食品。

sentences.english: Who vows to fight like a man for what's right night and day?
sentences.chinese: 是誰宣誓爲了正義不分晝夜的戰鬥？

sentences.english: Doctors and health workers are working around the clock to cope.
sentences.chinese: 醫生和保健工作者正在不分晝夜地工作。

sentences.english: Mutta-matutta nursed him night and day, with the sourest monkey-physic.
sentences.chinese: 瑪特瑪不分晝夜地照顧他，給他服下最酸的猴藥。

sentences.english: In the center of the hut a fire burned night and day from the beginning to the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 在小茅屋的中間終年不分晝夜地燃燒着爐火。

sentences.english: I was young, single, and willing to work all hours of the day and night.
sentences.chinese: 我年紀輕，又是單身一人，我願意不分晝夜的工作。

sentences.english: During the days in Shengzhen, Zhong Lijun went all out, working round the clock.
sentences.chinese: 在深圳的日子裏鍾麗君不分晝夜的奮力打拼。
